name: limitative
content:

causing or creating limits to something: Our experiment was only demonstrative and limitative because only two kinds of light ions were used. The past physically dominated and shaped the present and the future of the sacred sites, serving for the most part as a limitative factor.
More examplesFewer examplesWe therefore regard Theorem 2 as having genuine limitative import.He viewed the historian's role essentially in limitative terms, as defending ecclesiastical history against false accusations rather than contributing positively to the revelation of truth.
